data.title: Parallel unsteady flow line integral convolution for high-performance dense visualization
data.affiliation:
Ding, ZA (Corresponding Author), Purdue Univ, Dept Comp Sci, W Lafayette, IN 47907 USA.
Ding, Zi'ang, Purdue Univ, Dept Comp Sci, W Lafayette, IN 47907 USA.
Liu, Zhanping, Kentucky State Univ, Div Comp Sci, Frankfort, KY USA.
Yu, Yang; Chen, Wei, Zhejiang Univ, State Key Lab CAD\&CG, Hangzhou, Zhejiang, Peoples R China.
data.abstract: This paper presents an accurate parallel implementation of unsteady flow line integral convolution (UFLIC) for high-performance visualization of large time-varying flows. Our approach differs from previous implementations by using a novel value scattering+gathering mechanism to parallelize UFLIC and designing a pathline reuse strategy to reduce the computational cost of pathline integration. By exploiting the massive parallelism of modern graphical processing units (GPU), the proposed method allows for real-time dense visualization of unsteady flows with high spatial-temporal coherence.
